meanings.definition: A liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat soup on cold days.
meanings.sent2: My mom makes the best chicken noodle soup.
meanings.sent3: When I spilled my drink, it looked like a soup on the table.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a soup of cars during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The soup bubbled in the pot, filling the kitchen with a delicious aroma.

meanings.definition: To increase the power or effectiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding more spices can soup up the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The new software update will soup up your computer's performance.
meanings.sent3: I decided to soup up my bike with a shiny new bell.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker's words souped up the team's enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's suit was souped up with high-tech gadgets for extra strength.
